meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of a larger fragment.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist found tiny subfragments of pottery at the dig site.
meanings.sent2: She carefully collected the subfragments of glass scattered on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was missing a few subfragments, making it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like subfragments of a shattered mirror, reflecting only fragments of the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist used colorful subfragments to create a beautiful mosaic masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To break or divide into smaller pieces or fragments.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally subfragments the delicate vase while cleaning it.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused the ground to subfragments into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: She subfragments the cookie into tiny crumbs before feeding it to the birds.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise seemed to subfragments the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully subfragments the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
